Package com.shouldis.bitset

Class ConcurrentBitSet

java.lang.Object
com.shouldis.bitset.BitSet
com.shouldis.bitset.ConcurrentBitSet
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable
public final class ConcurrentBitSet
extends BitSet
Implementation of BitSet in which all methods capable of reading or writing the state of bits are delegated to atomic-operations.

The use of atomic operations allows concurrent modification of this ConcurrentBitSet without any external synchronization at the cost of processing time. These operations are done by the semantics of VarHandle.setVolatile(Object...). Note that operations affecting more than 1 word such as BitSet.not(), BitSet.and(BitSet), will only be made atomic on a per-word basis.

Author:
Aaron Shouldis
See Also:
BitSet, Serialized Form

    Ensures that the bit at the specified index is in the live state.
    void andWord​(int wordIndex, long mask)
    Changes the long word at wordIndex within BitSet.words to the result of an AND operation between the current value at the specified wordIndex within BitSet.words and the specified mask.

    Applies the specified WordFunction function to the word at the specified wordIndex.

    void notOrWord​(int wordIndex, long mask)
    Changes the long word at wordIndex within BitSet.words to the result of a NOT OR operation between the current value at the specified wordIndex within BitSet.words and the specified mask.

    Changes the long word at wordIndex within BitSet.words to the result of an OR operation between the current value at the specified wordIndex within BitSet.words and the specified mask.
    boolean remove​(int index)
    Ensures that the bit at the specified index is the dead state.
    void setWord​(int wordIndex, long word)
    Changes the long word at the specified wordIndex within BitSet.words, setting it to word.
    void setWordSegment​(int wordIndex, long word, long mask)
    Changes the long word at the specified wordIndex within BitSet.words such that it retains the previous state of bits where the bits of mask are in the dead state, and takes on the value of bits in word where mask has bits in the live state.
    void xOrWord​(int wordIndex, long mask)
    Changes the long word at wordIndex within BitSet.words to the result of an XOR operation between the current value at the specified wordIndex within BitSet.words and the specified mask.
